sound

Interface SoundFilter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSoundFilter

    public interface SoundFilter
    The SoundFilter interface. The sound filter class applies techniques to manipulate sounds to the sounds. Since buffering may be applied by the filters, you should create a new Soundfilter for every sound played. They can be reused however by calling the reset method after they are finished playing.
    Since:
    10-8-2014
    Version:
    10-8-2014
    Author:
    stefanboodt
    See Also:
    Sound, SoundManager

    • Method Detail

      • filter

        void filter(byte[] samples)
        Filters the samples. The samples should be 16 bit, signed, little-endian format.
        Parameters:
        samples - The array to filter.

      • filter

        void filter(byte[] samples,
            int offset,
            int length)
        Filters the samples. The samples should be 16 bit, signed, little-endian format. It starts on offset and then proceeds length.
        Parameters:
        samples - The array to filter.
        offset - The starting point.
        length - The length to continue after offset.

      • getRemainingSize

        default int getRemainingSize()
        Gets the remaining size, in bytes, that this filter plays sounds after the sound is finished. An example of other implementation would be an echo that plays longer than the original.
        Returns:
        0, by default.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets the filter so it can be used again.

      • getSample

        static short getSample(byte[] buffer,
                       int position)
        Convenience method for getting a 16-bit sample from a byte array. The samples should be 16 bit, signed, little-endian format.
        Parameters:
        buffer - The byte array of the sound.
        position - The position to start on.
        Returns:
        A short at the given location.

      • setSample

        static void setSample(byte[] buffer,
                      int position,
                      short sample)
        Convenience method for setting a 16-bit sample from a byte array. The samples should be 16 bit, signed, little-endian format.
        Parameters:
        buffer - The byte array of the sound.
        position - The position to start on.
        sample - The new short at the given location.
